LearnNonparam 1.2.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Examples

    Examples

    examples.Rmd
    library(LearnNonparam)

set.seed(2023)

    Chapter 1

    Example 1.1.2 

    # See ?Quantile or ?onesample.quantile
t <- pmt(
    "onesample.quantile", alternative = "greater",
    prob = 0.5, null_value = 75,
    type = "approx", correct = FALSE
)

# See ?Table1.1.1
t$test(Table1.1.1)

t$statistic
#> [1] 26
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.02888979
t$ci
#> [1] 75.0 77.1

    Example 1.2.1 

    # See ?CDF or ?onesample.cdf
t <- pmt("onesample.cdf")

# See ?Table1.2.1
t$test(Table1.2.1)

t$plot(style = "ggplot2")

    Example 1.2.4 

    # See ?Quantile or ?onesample.quantile
t <- pmt(
    "onesample.quantile",
    p = 0.25, null_value = 0, conf_level = 0.90
)

# See ?Table1.2.1
t$test(Table1.2.1)

t$ci
#> [1] 11 29

    Chapter 2

    Table 2.1.1 

    # See ?Difference or ?twosample.difference
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.difference", alternative = "greater", method = "mean"
)

# See ?Table2.1.1
t$test(Table2.1.1)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 16.16667
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.05714286

    Table 2.1.1 - wilcoxon 

    # See ?Wilcoxon or ?twosample.wilcoxon
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.wilcoxon", alternative = "greater"
)

# See ?Table2.1.1
t$test(Table2.1.1)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 21
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.05714286

    Example 2.3.1 

    # See ?Difference or ?twosample.difference
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.difference", alternative = "greater", method = "mean"
)

# See ?Table2.3.1
t$test(Table2.3.1)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 1.675

# all permutaions
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.1966589

# 1000 permutaions
t$n_permu <- 1000
#> 
 [K [0m
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.203

# install.packages("microbenchmark")
microbenchmark::microbenchmark(
    use_all = {t$n_permu <- 0},
    use_1000 = {t$n_permu <- 1000}
)
#>

    Example 2.6.1 

    # See ?Wilcoxon or ?twosample.wilcoxon
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.wilcoxon", alternative = "greater"
)

# See ?Table2.6.1
t$test(Table2.6.1)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 14
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.9

    Example 2.6.2 

    # See ?Wilcoxon or ?twosample.wilcoxon
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.wilcoxon", conf_level = 0.90
)

# See ?Table2.6.2
t$test(Table2.6.2)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$estimate
#> [1] NA
t$ci
#> [1] NA NA

    Example 2.7.1 

    # See ?ScoreSum or ?twosample.scoresum
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.scoresum", alternative = "greater", scoring = "expon"
)

# See ?Table2.6.2
t$test(Table2.6.2)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 9.752597
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.002164502

    Example 2.8.1 

    # See ?SiegelTukey or ?twosample.siegel
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.siegel", alternative = "greater", type = "approx"
)

# See ?Table2.8.1
t$test(Table2.8.1)

t$statistic
#> [1] 24
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.2654347

    Example 2.8.2 

    # See ?RatioDifferenceDeviance or ?twosample.rmd
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.rmd", alternative = "greater"
)

# See ?Table2.8.1
t$test(Table2.8.1)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 4.666667
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.06349206

    Example 2.8.3 

    # See ?KolmogorovSmirnov or ?twosample.ks
t <- pmt("twosample.ks")

# See ?Table2.8.1
t$test(Table2.8.1)
#>

t$statistic
#> [1] 0.4

#> [1] 0.8730159

    Chapter 3

    Example 3.1.1 

    # See ?ANOVA or ?ksample.anova
t <- pmt(
    "ksample.anova", type = "approx"
)

# See ?Table3.1.2
t$test(Table3.1.2)

t$statistic
#> [1] 3.781445
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.05327082

t$type <- "permu"
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 11552.89
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.05127412

    Example 3.2.1 

    # See ?KruskalWallis or ?ksample.kw
t <- pmt(
    "ksample.kw", type = "approx"
)

# See ?Table3.2.2
t$test(Table3.2.2)

t$statistic
#> [1] 17.14286
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.0006605027

    Example 3.2.2 & 3.2.3 

    # See ?KruskalWallis or ?ksample.kw
t <- pmt(
    "ksample.kw", n_permu = 4000
)

# See ?Table3.2.3
t$test(Table3.2.3)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 8.246588
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.0115


t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.01619109


t$scoring <- "expon"

t$n_permu <- 4000
t$type <- "permu"
#> 
 [K [0m
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.01375

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.02152193

    Example 3.3.1 

    # See ?MultiCompT or ?multicomp.t
t <- pmt(
    "multicomp.t", n_permu = 5000
)

# See ?Table3.3.1
t$test(Table3.3.1)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$print()
#> 
#>   Multiple Comparison Based on t Statistic 
#> 
#> scoring: none    type: permu(5000)    method: default    
#> 
#> family-wise confidence level: 95% 
#> 
#>     group_i    group_j   statistic p_value differ
#>  location_1 location_2  0.02737145  0.9790  FALSE
#>  location_1 location_3 -1.77914406  0.0888  FALSE
#>  location_1 location_4 -3.41048230  0.0030   TRUE
#>  location_2 location_3 -1.80651550  0.0896  FALSE
#>  location_2 location_4 -3.43785375  0.0028   TRUE
#>  location_3 location_4 -1.63133824  0.1198  FALSE

t$type <- "approx"
t$print()
#> 
#>   Multiple Comparison Based on t Statistic 
#> 
#> scoring: none    type: approx    method: default    
#> 
#> family-wise confidence level: 95% 
#> 
#>     group_i    group_j   statistic     p_value differ
#>  location_1 location_2  0.02737145 0.978434752  FALSE
#>  location_1 location_3 -1.77914406 0.090419680  FALSE
#>  location_1 location_4 -3.41048230 0.002773484   TRUE
#>  location_2 location_3 -1.80651550 0.085909110  FALSE
#>  location_2 location_4 -3.43785375 0.002603664   TRUE
#>  location_3 location_4 -1.63133824 0.118466249  FALSE

t$scoring <- "rank"
t$print()
#> 
#>   Multiple Comparison Based on t Statistic 
#> 
#> scoring: rank    type: approx    method: default    
#> 
#> family-wise confidence level: 95% 
#> 
#>     group_i    group_j  statistic     p_value differ
#>  location_1 location_2  0.1224745 0.902523250  FALSE
#>  location_1 location_3 -1.3880442 0.165123590  FALSE
#>  location_1 location_4 -2.6536139 0.007963489   TRUE
#>  location_2 location_3 -1.5105187 0.130911128  FALSE
#>  location_2 location_4 -2.7760884 0.005501725   TRUE
#>  location_3 location_4 -1.2655697 0.205667180  FALSE
    # See ?TukeyHSD or ?multicomp.tukey
t <- pmt(
    "multicomp.tukey", n_permu = 5000
)

t$test(Table3.3.1)
#>

t$print()

    Example 3.4.1 

    # See ?JonckheereTerpstra or ?ksample.jt
t <- pmt(
    "ksample.jt", alternative = "greater", n_permu = 4000
)

# See ?Table3.4.1
t$test(Table3.4.1)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 145
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.0295

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.0285154

    Chapter 4

    Table 4.1.1 

    # See ?SignedDiff or ?paired.signeddiff
t <- pmt(
    "paired.signeddiff", alternative = "greater",
    scoring = "none"
)

# See ?Table4.1.1
t$test(Table4.1.1)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 960
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.09375

    Example 4.1.1 

    # See ?SignedDiff or ?paired.signeddiff
t <- pmt(
    "paired.signeddiff", alternative = "two_sided",
    scoring = "none", method = "ignore"
)

# See ?Table4.1.3
t$test(Table4.1.3)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 148
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.02502441

t$n_permu <- 4000
#> 
 [K [0m
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.3495

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.0267714

    Example 4.2.1 & 4.2.2 

    # See ?SignedDiff or ?paired.signeddiff
t <- pmt(
    "paired.signeddiff", alternative = "greater",
    scoring = "rank", method = "with_zeros"
)

# See ?Table4.1.1
t$test(Table4.1.1)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 960
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.09375

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
#> [1] 0

    Table 4.2.3 

    # See ?SignedDiff or ?paired.signeddiff
t <- pmt(
    "paired.signeddiff", alternative = "greater",
    scoring = "rank", method = "ignore"
)

t$test(c(-5, -3, -3, 0, 0, 2, 4, 4, 4, 5), 0)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 19
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.265625

    Example 4.3.1 

    # See ?Sign or ?paired.sign
t <- pmt(
    "paired.sign", alternative = "greater", type = "exact"
)

t$test(c(rep(+1, 12), rep(-1, 5)), 0)

t$statistic
#> [1] 12
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.07173157

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.07280505

    Example 4.4.1 

    # See ?RCBDANOVA or ?rcbd.anova
t <- pmt(
    "rcbd.anova", n_permu = 5000
)

# See ?Table4.4.3
t$test(Table4.4.3)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 110241.8
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.054

t$type <- "approx"
t$statistic
#> [1] 3.121093
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.057516

    Chapter 5

    Example 5.1.1 

    # See ?Correlation or ?association.corr
t <- pmt(
    "association.corr", method = "pearson",
    alternative = "greater", n_permu = 2000
)

# See ?Table5.1.2
t$test(Table5.1.2)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 198766597
t$p_value
#> [1] 0

    Example 5.2.1 

    # See ?Correlation or ?association.corr
t <- pmt(
    "association.corr", method = "spearman",
    alternative = "greater", n_permu = 5000
)

# See ?Table5.1.2
t$test(Table5.1.2)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 2059
t$p_value
#> [1] 0

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
#> [1] 2.329431e-07

    Example 5.3.2 

    # See ?Correlation or ?association.corr
t <- pmt(
    "association.corr", method = "kendall",
    alternative = "greater", type = "approx"
)

# See ?Table5.2.2
t$test(Table5.2.2)

t$statistic
#> [1] 0.2222222
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.1697136

    Table 5.4.2 

    # See ?ChiSquare or ?table.chisq
t <- pmt("table.chisq")

# See ?Table5.4.2
t$test(Table5.4.2)
#> 
 [K [0m

t$statistic
#> [1] 4.277778
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.3142857

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
#> [1] 0.1177856
